cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River and about 200 mi SE of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn west-northwest tonight and then northwest on Friday, tracking toward the central/southeastern Louisiana coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City, central Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River westward to Cameron, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City (Tropical Storm); Mouth of the Atchafalaya River to Shell Beach (Storm Surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast, especially Louisiana coast from Intracoastal City to the Pearl River including the Mississippi Delta
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely Friday night into Saturday with a chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–6 ft possible along the lower Mississippi River delta and adjacent Louisiana coast, which can push upriver toward the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated totals near 20 inches possible at and around the port, leading to significant flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and widespread river/flash flooding that could disrupt port operations.
